content.question: Of the following dotplots, which represents the set of data that has the greatest standard deviation?

choices.label: Choice A has a horizontal line labeled 0 at the left and 10 at the right, and there are 10 asterisks distributed along the line. Choice A has the asterisks evenly distributed.

Choice B has a horizontal line labeled 0 at the left and 10 at the right, and there are 10 asterisks distributed along the line. Choice B has 5 asterisks all the way to the left and 5 all the way to the right.

Choice C has a horizontal line labeled 0 at the left and 10 at the right, and there are 10 asterisks distributed along the line. Choice C has three all the way to the left, three all the way to the right, and four in the middle.

Choice D has a horizontal line labeled 0 at the left and 10 at the right, and there are 10 asterisks distributed along the line. Choice D has four all the way to the left, four all the way to the right, and two in the middle.

Choice E has a horizontal line labeled 0 at the left and 10 at the right, and there are 10 asterisks distributed along the line. Choice E has two all the way to the left, two all the way to the right, and then six in pairs around the middle.

content.answer: Choice B has a horizontal line labeled 0 at the left and 10 at the right, and there are 10 asterisks distributed along the line. Choice B has 5 asterisks all the way to the left and 5 all the way to the right.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
